alert.note: Alert for West Carteret (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 3:23PM EDT until June 05 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Areas along Bogue Banks beaches, Bogue Sound, the Newport and White Oak Rivers, and adjacent tidal creeks. * WHEN...Until 2 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in a low threat of property damage. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. High tide is in between 8 and 10 PM tonight. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Beaufort Marine Lab NC MLLW Categories - Minor 5.0 ft, Moderate 5.5 ft, Major 6.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor -0.8 ft, Moderate -0.3 ft, Major 0.7 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 04/09 PM 5.6 -0.2 1.6 1 Moderate 05/09 AM 3.8 -2.0 1.4 1 None 05/10 PM 4.8 -1.0 0.8 1 None 06/10 AM 3.4 -2.4 1.0 1 None 06/10 PM 4.4 -1.4 0.8 1 None 07/11 AM 3.3 -2.5 0.8 1 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
